predictions.text: CME Henry Hub natural gas front-month futures (ticker: NG) will settle at or below $2.50 per MMBtu on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via CME Group official daily settlement price for the prompt-month NG contract. Any settlement <= $2.50/MMBtu through 2025-11-30 (UTC) counts.
monitoring_signals: EIA working gas in storage vs. 5-year average
Lower 48 dry gas production and pipeline flows
LNG export outages/maintenance (e.g., Freeport)
Heating degree day forecasts (NOAA/CPC)
Henry Hub cash prices and prompt/second-month spread
predictions.rationale: High storage and mild autumn weather increase odds of a sub-$2.50 test before winter demand ramps.

predictions.text: Cboe Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or above 25.00 on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Cboe official VIX closing print >= 25.00 on any trading day before the deadline.
monitoring_signals: S&P 500 1-day drawdowns >1.5%
Earnings surprises/guidance cuts from mega-caps
Geopolitical escalations and sanctions headlines
VIX futures term structure inversion (front > back)
Credit spreads (CDX IG/HY) widening
predictions.rationale: Earnings season and geopolitical tensions raise tail-risk; a single risk-off day can spike VIX above 25.

predictions.text: HFRI Fund Weighted Composite Index preliminary return for October 2025 will be between +0.4% and +2.0%, per HFR’s release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use Hedge Fund Research’s preliminary October 2025 performance published on hfr.com by 2025-11-15. Range refers to monthly percentage return.
monitoring_signals: HFRX Global Hedge Fund Index daily estimates
S&P 500, MSCI ACWI, and credit index monthly returns
MOVE/VIX levels (risk-adjusted strategy performance)
Macro CTA trend signals across rates/FX/commodities
predictions.rationale: Record AUM and supportive risk sentiment point to modest positive October performance.

predictions.text: U.S. Total Vehicle Sales (SAAR, FRED: TOTALSA) for October 2025 will print between 15.0 million and 16.2 million.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed via FRED series TOTALSA or BEA monthly vehicle sales release for October 2025; the reported SAAR must fall within the range.
monitoring_signals: OEM monthly sales updates and incentive levels
Dealer inventory days’ supply (Cox/J.D. Power)
Auto loan rates and credit availability
Gasoline prices and consumer confidence indices
predictions.rationale: Despite high prices, inventories and incentives support a mid-15M SAAR outcome.

predictions.text: Atlanta Fed Wage Growth Tracker (12-month moving median) for October 2025 will print between 4.5% and 5.3%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified by the Atlanta Fed Wage Growth Tracker page once the October 2025 value is posted; value must fall within the range.
monitoring_signals: BLS Average Hourly Earnings (YoY)
Indeed/Wage trackers for posted wages
JOLTS quits rate and job openings
NFIB compensation plans index
predictions.rationale: Wage growth is easing gradually but remains elevated relative to pre-2020 norms.

predictions.text: China NBS Manufacturing PMI for October 2025 will print between 50.0 and 50.8.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the official NBS of China manufacturing PMI figure for October 2025 published on stats.gov.cn; seasonally adjusted headline PMI.
monitoring_signals: Caixin Manufacturing PMI
Export order metrics and port throughput
Power consumption and steel output
High-frequency mobility and truck freight indexes
predictions.rationale: Policy support and improved sentiment likely keep PMI slightly in expansion.

predictions.text: AAA U.S. national average regular gasoline price will print at or below $3.40 per gallon on at least one day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirmed via AAA Daily National Average on gasprices.aaa.com; any national average regular price reading <= $3.40/gal before deadline satisfies.
monitoring_signals: RBOB gasoline futures and crack spreads
Refinery utilization/outages (PADD 3/5)
Crude prices and inventories
Seasonal demand trends and implied gasoline demand
predictions.rationale: Seasonal demand softness and improving supply could push averages lower into late fall.

predictions.text: USD/MXN (Yahoo Finance: MXN=X) will trade at or above 19.00 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Yahoo Finance (MXN=X) intraday high or daily high reaching >= 19.00 on any UTC trading day counts.
monitoring_signals: Banxico policy guidance and inflation prints
U.S. risk sentiment (DXY, VIX) and UST yields
Oil prices (impacting Mexico terms of trade)
Regional political/security headlines
predictions.rationale: Rising risk aversion and regional tensions can pressure MXN, prompting a brief spike above 19.

predictions.text: IBM Q3 2025 total revenue year-over-year growth will be between +2% and +6%, per the company’s earnings release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use IBM’s official Q3 2025 earnings release or Form 8-K/press release to compare total revenue vs. Q3 2024; YoY growth must be within range.
monitoring_signals: IBM Software and Consulting segment growth
Infrastructure zSystems cycle and FX impacts
Backlog and book-to-bill commentary
Macro IT spending surveys
predictions.rationale: Steady software/consulting growth and FX tailwinds support low- to mid-single-digit YoY revenue growth.

predictions.text: Euro area Industrial Production (MoM, SA) for September 2025 will print between -0.6% and +0.4%, per Eurostat.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified via Eurostat news release on industrial production for September 2025 (seasonally adjusted MoM for the euro area).
monitoring_signals: Germany and France national IP releases
Euro area manufacturing PMI output index
Energy prices and gas storage levels
Export orders/new orders trends
predictions.rationale: Soft manufacturing PMIs suggest flat-to-slightly negative output, with energy costs a continued headwind.

predictions.text: U.S. initial jobless claims 4-week moving average will reach at or above 230,000 in at least one weekly Department of Labor report by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the 4-week moving average figure in the DOL Unemployment Insurance Weekly Claims news release; any reading >= 230,000 before deadline qualifies.
monitoring_signals: Continuing claims (insured unemployment) trend
Challenger job cuts announcements
NFIB hiring plans and job openings
Regional Fed employment components (Philly, Empire)
predictions.rationale: Gradual labor-market cooling and rising continuing claims make a 4-week average uptick plausible.
